protocolMetaData.title: Protocol for the fast chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) method

item.comment: Add 40 ml of 37% (wt/vol) formaldehyde per 1 ml of overlaying medium to obtain a final concentration of 1.42%.
Quench formaldehyde with 125 mM glycine for 5 min at room temperature (141 ml of 1 M glycine per 1 ml of medium).
Wash cell pellette with 5-10mL ice cold PBS.
PAUSE POINT. Cell pelettes can be stored at -80C for at least a year.
IP buffer containing protease inhibitors (and phosphatase inhibitors if needed)
There will be a lot of insoluble material
Containing protease inhibitors (and phosphatase inhibitors, if needed)
Optimise on your specific cell sample

10%(w/v) Chelex 100 slurry.
Cut off the tips of piptte tips and pipette when adding.
PAUSE POINT. The cromatin can be stored at -80C for months.

10%(w/v) Chelex 100 slurry.
Cut off the tips of piptte tips and pipette when adding.
Store at ?20 1C . We have thawed and frozen the samples repeatedly (more than 20 times over months) without loss of PCR signal
Store at ?20 1C . We have thawed and frozen the samples repeatedly (more than 20 times over months) without loss of PCR signal
40 cycles using the default three step method. ABI 7900
Acquire data using the SDS 2.2.1 program (ABI Biotechnology).
40 cycles using the default three step method. ABI 7900
Acquire data using the SDS 2.2.1 program (ABI Biotechnology).
